purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A girl 女 made of beautiful jade 圭
purpleculture_examples:
夏娃 [ xià wá ]: Eve, the first woman (transcription used in Protestant versions of the Bible) (from Hebrew Ḥawwāh, probably via Cantonese 夏娃 {Haa6waa1})
娃娃亲 [ wá wa qīn ]: arranged betrothal of minors
布娃娃 [ bù wá wa ]: rag doll
小娃 [ xiǎo wá ]: child
伊娃 [ yī wá ]: Eva (name)

heisig_chinese_memo: A woman takes a picture of her newborn baby framed by ivy.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the woman (女) with the jewel (圭) is beautiful
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A woman takes a picture of her newborn baby framed by ivy.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " female " to " gui " sound. "Shuowen" is based on the original meaning of round and deep eyes. "Shu Wen": "A baby, a deep and deep eye." In the land of Wu and Chu, " baby " is used to express beautiful appearance. "Shuowen": "Or: Wu Chu's leisure called a good Yue baby." "Dialect. Second": "Baby, maiden, slim, beautiful, beautiful. Wu Chu Henghuai called a baby."

" Baby " by extension means beauty. Such as "Selected Works. Zuo Taichong's "Wu Du Fu": "Fortunately, in the palace of the children of the Guan, Zhang's girl entertains the officials." Liu Kui's note: "Wu custom said that a good girl is a baby." During the Spring and Autumn Period, Wu Wang Fucha built for Xi Shi. Guanwa Palace". Because Wu people call beautiful women " babies ", "Guanwa Palace" means the palace where beautiful women live. Another example is Bai Juyi's "City Night Banquet" in the Tang Dynasty: "Why is it so hard to listen to poetry, but Wu Wa is persuaded by Wu Wa to stop drinking."

" Baby " refers to women in general. Such as the Anonymous "Hedong Ji." Banqiao Sanniang: "The Three Niangs of the Store Baby, I don't know where they are, they live in widowhood, they are more than 30 years old, have no male or female, and no relatives." Southern Song Zhou Mi, "Wulin History. "Lighting Products": "There are also dear girls, cut out of paper, especially delicate."

" Baby " represents more than a child, children. For example, Lu Guimeng of the Tang Dynasty "Moshang Sang": "The neighboring baby is doing all the embroidering the crotch and picking silkworm leaves alone." "Journey to the West" Chapter 49: "The earth is the mother, and the golden bud is born. ; Water is the foundation, the wood is smooth, and there is no glorious fire."
humanum_short_description_en: From " female " to " Kyu " sound. " Baby " represents more than a child, the child, the feminine.
humanum_full_description:
從「女」，「圭」聲。《說文》以為本義是眼睛圓且深的樣子。《說文》：「娃，圜深目皃。」一說吳、楚之地以「娃」表示美好貌。《說文》：「或曰：吳楚之閒謂好曰娃。」《方言．第二》：「娃、嫷、窕、豔，美也。吳楚衡淮之間曰娃。」

　　「娃」引申表示美女。如《文選．左太沖〈吳都賦〉》：「幸乎館娃之宮，張女樂而娛群臣。」劉逵注：「吳俗謂好女為娃。」春秋時吳王夫差為西施建造「館娃宮」。因吳人呼美女為「娃」，「館娃宮」意謂美女所居之宮。又如唐代白居易〈城上夜宴〉：「詩聽越客吟何苦，酒被吳娃勸不休。」

　　「娃」後泛指女性。如唐代無名氏《河東記．板橋三娘》：「店娃三娘子者，不知何從來，寡居，年三十餘，無男女，亦無親屬。」南宋周密《武林舊事．燈品》：「又有深閨巧娃，剪紙而成，尤為精妙。」

　　「娃」多表示小孩、兒童。如唐代陸龜蒙〈陌上桑〉：「鄰娃盡著繡襠襦，獨自提筐采蠶葉。」《西遊記》第49回：「土是母，發金芽，金生神水產嬰娃；水為本，潤木華，木有輝煌烈火霞。」
humanum_short_description: 從「女」，「圭」聲。「娃」多表示小孩、兒童，亦指女性。
